016
017package org.parboiled.common;
018
019import static imagingbook.parboiled.common.Preconditions.*;
020
021import java.util.Collection;
022
023public final class Predicates {
024
025    private Predicates() {}
026
027    /**
028     * Returns a predicate that always evaluates to {@code true}.
029     *
030     * @return a predicate
031     */
032    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
033    public static <T> Predicate<T> alwaysTrue() {
034        return (Predicate<T>) AlwaysTruePredicate.INSTANCE;
035    }
036
037    /**
038     * Returns a predicate that always evaluates to {@code false}.
039     *
040     * @return a predicate
041     */
042    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
043    public static <T> Predicate<T> alwaysFalse() {
044        return (Predicate<T>) AlwaysFalsePredicate.INSTANCE;
045    }
046
047    /**
048     * Returns a predicate that evaluates to {@code true} if the object reference
049     * being tested is null.
050     *
051     * @return a predicate
052     */
053    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
054    public static <T> Predicate<T> isNull() {
055        return (Predicate<T>) IsNullPredicate.INSTANCE;
056    }
057
058    /**
059     * Returns a predicate that evaluates to {@code true} if the object reference
060     * being tested is not null.
061     *
062     * @return a predicate
063     */
064    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
065    public static <T> Predicate<T> notNull() {
066        return (Predicate<T>) NotNullPredicate.INSTANCE;
067    }
068
069    /**
070     * Returns a predicate that evaluates to {@code true} if the given predicate
071     * evaluates to {@code false}.
072     *
073     * @param predicate the inner predicate
074     * @return a predicate
075     */
076    public static <T> Predicate<T> not(Predicate<T> predicate) {
077        return new NotPredicate<T>(predicate);
078    }
079
080    /**
081     * Returns a predicate that evaluates to {@code true} if each of its
082     * components evaluates to {@code true}. The components are evaluated in
083     * order, and evaluation will be "short-circuited" as soon as a false
084     * predicate is found. It defensively copies the iterable passed in, so future
085     * changes to it won't alter the behavior of this predicate. If {@code
086     * components} is empty, the returned predicate will always evaluate to {@code
087     * true}.
088     *
089     * @param components the components
090     * @return a predicate
091     */
092    public static <T> Predicate<T> and(Collection<? extends Predicate<? super T>> components) {
093        return new AndPredicate<T>(components);
094    }
095
096    /**
097     * Returns a predicate that evaluates to {@code true} if each of its
098     * components evaluates to {@code true}. The components are evaluated in
099     * order, and evaluation will be "short-circuited" as soon as a false
100     * predicate is found. It defensively copies the array passed in, so future
101     * changes to it won't alter the behavior of this predicate. If {@code
102     * components} is empty, the returned predicate will always evaluate to {@code
103     * true}.
104     *
105     * @param components the components
106     * @return a predicate
107     */
108    public static <T> Predicate<T> and(Predicate<? super T>... components) {
109        return new AndPredicate<T>(ImmutableList.of(components));
110    }
111
112    /**
113     * Returns a predicate that evaluates to {@code true} if both of its
114     * components evaluate to {@code true}. The components are evaluated in
115     * order, and evaluation will be "short-circuited" as soon as a false
116     * predicate is found.
117     *
118     * @param first the first
119     * @param second the second
120     * @return a predicate
121     */
122    public static <T> Predicate<T> and(Predicate<? super T> first, Predicate<? super T> second) {
123        checkArgNotNull(first, "first");
124        checkArgNotNull(second, "second");
125        return new AndPredicate<T>(ImmutableList.<Predicate<? super T>>of(first, second));
126    }
127
128    /**
129     * Returns a predicate that evaluates to {@code true} if any one of its
130     * components evaluates to {@code true}. The components are evaluated in
131     * order, and evaluation will be "short-circuited" as soon as as soon as a
132     * true predicate is found. It defensively copies the iterable passed in, so
133     * future changes to it won't alter the behavior of this predicate. If {@code
134     * components} is empty, the returned predicate will always evaluate to {@code
135     * false}.
136     *
137     * @param components the components
138     * @return a predicate
139     */
140    public static <T> Predicate<T> or(Collection<? extends Predicate<? super T>> components) {
141        return new OrPredicate<T>(components);
142    }
143
144    /**
145     * Returns a predicate that evaluates to {@code true} if any one of its
146     * components evaluates to {@code true}. The components are evaluated in
147     * order, and evaluation will be "short-circuited" as soon as as soon as a
148     * true predicate is found. It defensively copies the array passed in, so
149     * future changes to it won't alter the behavior of this predicate. If {@code
150     * components} is empty, the returned predicate will always evaluate to {@code
151     * false}.
152     *
153     * @param components the components
154     * @return a predicate
155     */
156    public static <T> Predicate<T> or(Predicate<? super T>... components) {
157        return new OrPredicate<T>(ImmutableList.of(components));
158    }
159
160    /**
161     * Returns a predicate that evaluates to {@code true} if either of its
162     * components evaluates to {@code true}. The components are evaluated in
163     * order, and evaluation will be "short-circuited" as soon as as soon as a
164     * true predicate is found.
165     *
166     * @param first the first
167     * @param second the second
168     * @return a predicate
169     */
170    public static <T> Predicate<T> or(Predicate<? super T> first, Predicate<? super T> second) {
171        checkArgNotNull(first, "first");
172        checkArgNotNull(second, "second");
173        return new OrPredicate<T>(ImmutableList.<Predicate<? super T>>of(first, second));
174    }
175
176    /**
177     * Returns a predicate that evaluates to {@code true} if the object being
178     * tested {@code equals()} the given target or both are null.
179     *
180     * @param target the target
181     * @return a predicate
182     */
183    public static <T> Predicate<T> equalTo(T target) {
184        return (target == null) ? Predicates.<T>isNull() : new IsEqualToPredicate<T>(target);
185    }
186
187    /**
188     * Returns a predicate that evaluates to {@code true} if the object being
189     * tested is an instance of the given class. If the object being tested
190     * is {@code null} this predicate evaluates to {@code false}.
191     *
192     * @param clazz the clazz
193     * @return a predicate
194     */
195    public static Predicate<Object> instanceOf(Class<?> clazz) {
196        return new InstanceOfPredicate(clazz);
197    }
198
199    /**
200     * Returns a predicate that evaluates to {@code true} if the object reference
201     * being tested is a member of the given collection. It does not defensively
202     * copy the collection passed in, so future changes to it will alter the
203     * behavior of the predicate.
204     *
205     * This method can technically accept any {@code Collection<?>}, but using a typed
206     * collection helps prevent bugs. This approach doesn't block any potential
207     * users since it is always possible to use {@code Predicates.<Object>in()}.
208     *
209     * @param target the collection that may contain the function input
210     * @return a predicate
211     */
212    public static <T> Predicate<T> in(Collection<? extends T> target) {
213        return new InPredicate<T>(target);
214    }
215
216    private static class AlwaysTruePredicate implements Predicate<Object> {
217        private static final Predicate<Object> INSTANCE = new AlwaysTruePredicate();
218
219        public boolean apply(Object o) {
220            return true;
221        }
222
223        @Override
224        public
225        String toString() {
226            return "AlwaysTrue";
227        }
228    }
229
230    private static class AlwaysFalsePredicate implements Predicate<Object> {
231        private static final Predicate<Object> INSTANCE = new AlwaysFalsePredicate();
232
233        public boolean apply(Object o) {
234            return false;
235        }
236
237        @Override
238        public String toString() {
239            return "AlwaysFalse";
240        }
241    }
242
243    private static class NotPredicate<T> implements Predicate<T> {
244        private final Predicate<T> predicate;
245
246        private NotPredicate(Predicate<T> predicate) {
247            checkArgNotNull(predicate, "predicate");
248            this.predicate = predicate;
249        }
250
251        public boolean apply(T t) {
252            return !predicate.apply(t);
253        }
254
255        public String toString() {
256            return "Not(" + predicate.toString() + ")";
257        }
258    }
259
260    private static class AndPredicate<T> implements Predicate<T> {
261        private final Collection<? extends Predicate<? super T>> components;
262
263        private AndPredicate(Collection<? extends Predicate<? super T>> components) {
264            this.components = components;
265        }
266
267        public boolean apply(T t) {
268            for (Predicate<? super T> predicate : components) {
269                if (!predicate.apply(t)) {
270                    return false;
271                }
272            }
273            return true;
274        }
275
276        @Override
277        public String toString() {
278            return "And(" + StringUtils.join(components, ", ") + ")";
279        }
280    }
281
282    private static class OrPredicate<T> implements Predicate<T> {
283        private final Collection<? extends Predicate<? super T>> components;
284
285        private OrPredicate(Collection<? extends Predicate<? super T>> components) {
286            this.components = components;
287        }
288
289        public boolean apply(T t) {
290            for (Predicate<? super T> predicate : components) {
291                if (predicate.apply(t)) {
292                    return true;
293                }
294            }
295            return false;
296        }
297
298        @Override
299        public String toString() {
300            return "Or(" + StringUtils.join(components, ", ") + ")";
301        }
302    }
303
304    private static class IsEqualToPredicate<T> implements Predicate<T> {
305        private final T target;
306
307        private IsEqualToPredicate(T target) {
308            this.target = target;
309        }
310
311        public boolean apply(T t) {
312            return target.equals(t);
313        }
314
315        @Override
316        public String toString() {
317            return "IsEqualTo(" + target + ")";
318        }
319    }
320
321    private static class InstanceOfPredicate implements Predicate<Object> {
322        private final Class<?> clazz;
323
324        private InstanceOfPredicate(Class<?> clazz) {
325            checkArgNotNull(clazz, "clazz");
326            this.clazz = clazz;
327        }
328
329        public boolean apply(Object o) {
330            return clazz.isInstance(o);
331        }
332
333        @Override
334        public String toString() {
335            return "IsInstanceOf(" + clazz.getName() + ")";
336        }
337    }
338
339    private static class IsNullPredicate implements Predicate<Object> {
340        private static final Predicate<Object> INSTANCE = new IsNullPredicate();
341
342        public boolean apply(Object o) {
343            return o == null;
344        }
345
346        @Override
347        public String toString() {
348            return "IsNull";
349        }
350    }
351
352    private static class NotNullPredicate implements Predicate<Object> {
353        private static final Predicate<Object> INSTANCE = new NotNullPredicate();
354
355        public boolean apply(Object o) {
356            return o != null;
357        }
358
359        @Override
360        public String toString() {
361            return "NotNull";
362        }
363    }
364
365    private static class InPredicate<T> implements Predicate<T> {
366        private final Collection<?> target;
367
368        private InPredicate(Collection<?> target) {
369            checkArgNotNull(target, "target");
370            this.target = target;
371        }
372
373        public boolean apply(T t) {
374            try {
375                return target.contains(t);
376            } catch (NullPointerException e) {
377                return false;
378            } catch (ClassCastException e) {
379                return false;
380            }
381        }
382
383        @Override
384        public String toString() {
385            return "In(" + target + ")";
386        }
387    }
388
389}
